Message.Title: Here are the discovered Iphone 5 problems so far
Message.Msg: So there's been quite a bit of press surrounding some reported problems, including poor Wi-Fi connections, light leaking from the crack of the power button, and iPhones coming out of the box with scratches. It seems Siri also is giving wrong weather reports. It was discovered that Verizon iPhone 5 devices come unlocked. That makes it easy for customers to pop in an AT&T SIM card and have it work on AT&T's network. I wouldn't be surprised if more iPhone 5 quirks are discovered in the next week. Some iPhone 5s, for example, show an odd bubble effect when their users press the screen too hard. Others report that their screens are flickering and are blurry in some areas. iPhone 5 owners taking to forums to talk about the latest problem whereupon some of the white models of the latest iPhone seem to have light leakage. This is occurring between the display glass and the aluminum antenna, according to a BGR report and the area to look at is around the power button where there may be a small crack. The issue is being discussed on the MacRumors forums so BGR took a close look at one of its own iPhone 5s and did indeed see a loosening chamfer and light leakage near to the power button. owners of Apple’s new iPhone 5 are having problems with WiFi, with some devices having really slow WiFi and also no connectivity. But it’s already clear that the while the adapters may be only a minor annoyance for some add-ons, they won’t work at all with others, including those that require an analog audio signal - video or iPod output. Then there’s the physical issue. While an adapter may work well with cable connections, using it with cradle-type peripherals could be problematic.

Message.Title: Tim Cook you screwed up
Message.Msg: Not sure why he didnt offer ios6 upgrade with option to retain google maps and youtube ap instead of forcing users to lose those. What kind of logic is that to tell customers, "Well if you want this, you have to lose that.". This is exactly why many consumers and techies HATE Apple, telling them what they can and cant easily use their products for. Cook did the same thing with the latest MacBooks which do not have easy changeability of internal parts thus making their products unupgradeable and forced obsolescene. Ive been an Apple bull for years but this is the kind of Big Brother merchandising which i feared. Cook apparently forgot the past in only a year and is repeating the same mistake Apple did decades ago with overcontrol of the user experience to the negative. Coworker showed me the 5 he got over the weekend and visually i wasnt impressed with the stretched screen. I dont think anyone has ever said that the iphone screen just isn't tall enough. Cook should have increased the screen size both height n width and keep same proportions with Apps shrunk to make 5 across and 6 rows. And start giving customers the best user experience again and offer them the ability to load goog map app and youtube app back on to phone. Do it quick before you lose more customers who either dont upgrade or switch to Samsung. And really, TomTom???? - the worst GPS company. I swear if Jobs was really thinking these things before he passed, he should have stepped down earlier. These four things were all poor decisions, five if you add the Mac hard build.

Message.Title: Waiting to buy iPhone 5
Message.Msg: So many people in my work place are going to buy iphone 5. 90% of them have not ordered yet, even some of those diehard Apple fans. Many of their family members are also waiting. Most of us will buy before the end of year. Everyone has a good job and family is so busy nowadays. There is no rush to buy a phone. In my work place, less than 1% potential buyers got their iPhone 5 so far. Many Android users are switching to iPhone in my work place. The main reason is that android phone's battery is terrible, lasting 2 hours after used less than a year. Buy a new battery is cost a lot money. Some of them are carrying 2 -3 batteries. The other reason is the android phone was running great for the first three months then it become slow due to junky softwares. Those poor Samsung phone and Motorola phone screens lose color saturation fast. A good photo looks terrible a few months later. Just loaded more AAPL share today plus call options. Will load more if AAPL drops below 680. Happy day!

Message.Title: New Hong Kong Store
Message.Msg: Lost in the shuffle of news was the announcement that Apple will open a 2nd Hong Kong store this weekend. This store will be located at the Festival Walk shopping mall. The significance of this Festival Walk store is: 1. The Festival Walk shopping mall is the first top quality shopping mall that Chinese tourists taking the train from Shenzen, China to Hong Kong come across. 2. This mall is located on top of arguably the busiest underground (subway) station in Hong Kong, where Chinese tourists can get off of the train from China and get onto the Hong Kong underground (subway) network. 3. Tourists from China continue to flood into Hong Kong to buy products that aren't fakes. Until the iPhone5 is released in China at the end of the year, this new Hong Kong store makes it even easier for Apple customers from China to buy the new iPhone and any other Apple products they want while visiting Hong Kong. The original Apple store in Hong Kong is located in a mall that's a bit more difficult to get to. There's no high-end shopping mall that's easier to reach for mainland Chinese visitors to Hong Kong than the Festival Walk shopping mall. Period. Very wise move Apple.

I can get a smart phone device and a GO plan for $25.00 per month that includes: Unlimited nationwide text, picture/sound/video messages plus 250 minutes of calling in US per month. Message.Msg: While much ado has been made out of Apple "only" selling 5 million iPhone 5s in the opening weekend of sales, some analysts have hailed the achievement, saying that expectations of much higher unit sales weren't realistic.
